summary: BATMAN/SUPERMAN #2 written by JOSHUA WILLIAMSON art and cover by DAVID MARQUEZ variant cover by JEROME OPENA The Batman Who...
caption:
BATMAN/SUPERMAN #2

written by JOSHUA WILLIAMSON
art and cover by DAVID MARQUEZ
variant cover by JEROME OPENA
The Batman Who Laughs’ plot is bigger than either the Caped Crusader or the Man of Steel realized. Following a showdown with the devious killer’s first sentinel, a jacked-up, Dark Multiverse-infected Shazam!, the pair has to figure out who else has been targeted for similar transformations. Their first two guesses: someone very close to Batman and the one hero that would make failure nearly impossible—Superman himself!
ON SALE 09.25.19
$3.99 US | 32 PAGES
FC | RATED T
This issue will ship with two covers.
Please see the order form for details.

summary: Finally got to see Captain Marvel while on my flight from Chicago. It was so good!! Especially the montage of Carol getting back...
body: Finally got to see Captain Marvel while on my flight from Chicago. It was so good!! Especially the montage of Carol getting back up every time in her life. I wanted to cry! I also liked all of the 90’s music. Brought me back to high school. ^^ I know I’m late to the party, but watch it!!

blog.name: weirdmarvelpredictions
blog.title: I Try To See The Future
blog.description: I use an old set of tarot cards and write whatever silly things they tell me will happen in the mcu. Suggestions and questions are welcome.

summary: Maria and Yon-Rogg fall in love
body:
Maria and Yon-Rogg fall in love

They will realize their love for each other during a dark time when Yon-Rogg thinks there is no hope but Maria convince him to keep fighting. She will admire his discipline, he will admire her resolve and straightforwardness.

summary: Thinking about carol's age...  how old is she supposed to be ? 50-ish? She didn't aged... she looks like 30, so if they give her...
question: Thinking about carol's age...  how old is she supposed to be ? 50-ish? She didn't aged... she looks like 30, so if they give her a love interest in her next movie and the person is also 30-ish would it be weird because carol is actually on her fifties? But wouldn't also be weird if the person is 50-ish because they will actually look that age  and it might be weird to see brie with someone really older. It's kind of similar to cap but cap was frozen so he has the life experience of a 25 ish
answer:
the mcu has put themselves in an interesting position wrt carol and her age. i think the choice to set captain marvel in the 90s was the right one, because that is an unexplored area of mcu history and a place in which carol can carve out her own niche, but then bringing her back for the teamup in the modern timeline raises some questions that aren’t addressed.

i would assume that, given the fact that her powers come from the space stone/tesseract, that would slow down her natural aging, on top of her kree blood transfusion, on top of the fact that carol’s been traveling in space for a lot of years now and there’s time dilation involved with that. so in earth years she’s in her 50s now, but biologically she has not aged 50+ years through… well, right now we have a combination of potential explanations, but i guess marvel wants to use the kree blood thing? it seems kind of weak to me as a justification on its own but…. waves hands

title: May I Have This Dance?
body:
Pride Prompt #17.2 (Carol x Fem!Reader)

Request: Hellooo may i request a carol x reader for pride month about carol feeling kinda insecure about showing affection to her gf in public because she has been in space for so long and doesn’t know that things changed a lot?

Note: Sooo, here’s as promised the second version, it’s very different from the other tbh xD I hope you guys like it, feedback is as always greatly appreciated <3

Warnings: none

Pairing: Carol Danvers x Fem!Reader

Words: 1835

Find my other Pride fics here.

.

You and Carol had been dancing around each other ever since the day you first met her 6 years ago when she arrived at the compound answering Fury’s call. She was beautiful, she was badass, she was kind… You were completely enamoured of her. And yet, you never actually said something about it to her, she liked you too, at least so you thought. You spend a lot of time together, talking and laughing about literally anything, but never really flirty, she might just see you as a friend, you thought and  today that assumption seemed to be proven as true.

Tony and Pepper were holding their second wedding to renew their vows now that all the dusted had been brought back and Thanos defeated. You and Carol had been seated at the same table and she was telling you about a wedding she had once attended on Hala, you always loved it when she told you about other galaxies and planets, but you never could keep the thought from your mind that there couldn’t possibly be someone or something more otherworldly than her.

You found your gaze trailing down to her lips as she spoke and only noticed what you were doing when Carol cleared her throat.

“Are you even listening to me?” She gave you a little shove and grinned.

Flustered you rubbed your neck. “Yeah, of course,” you finally met her gaze again, “I was just thinking, would you like to have a dance with me?”

It was only a dance, you told yourself, not an invitation for a date… There was absolutely no reason for your heart to beat as fast as it did in that moment.

“I- uhm- I don’t dance,” she evaded your gaze, seeming nervous, panicked even and you brushed it off with a smile, trying to hide your disappointment and excused yourself, saying that you should probably find Tony and Pepper anyway to congratulate them.

In the end it was only Tony you found, he was in the kitchen, looking for some extra dishes. He looked up when he heard you enter. You quickly gapped the space between you and wrapped your arms around him.

“I’m so happy for you, Tony,” you pulled away and smiled at him.

“Thank you, Y/N,” the pure joy that sparkled in Tony’s eyes when he answered was something you rarely saw on him, “Mind helping me?”

“Of course not,” you accepted the plates he handed you and walked outside with him again.

Tony nodded over to where Carol was still sitting at the table, now talking with Fury and smirked at you. “How’s it going with Danvers?”

You nearly let the plates drop. “Wh-What?”

Your answer only made your friend grin wider. “Come on, you are made for each other… I thought a romantic setting like this would maybe finally get you two to admit your feelings for each other.”

“Are you trying to set us up?”

“I just want to help you out,” he nudged your side with his shoulder.

“Whatever,” you rolled your eyes, “It doesn’t matter anyway, because she clearly doesn’t like me like that.”

Tony laughed, but stopped when he realized your sad expression. “Wait, seriously? No way, N/N. She’s pining for you just as much as you are pining for her, everyone can see that.”

You arrived at the buffet and set the dishes down but remained standing there with Tony as you kept on talking.

“Well, I don’t think she does.”

You tried to hide how much the thought hurt you, but Tony knew you too well, he wrapped an arm around your shoulders and pulled you into his side.

“She doesn’t even want to dance with me, she said ‘I don’t dance’ as if we haven’t been out for karaoke a thousand times with her dancing on table tops, maybe I shouldn’t have asked when there was such a slow song playing… She looked so uncomfortable when I asked her, Tony, maybe she isn’t even into girls.”

“Or maybe she’s just shy?”

“You sure we’re talking about the same Carol Danvers? Captain Marvel, Ms. ‘Because before you didn’t have me’?”

Tony rolled his eyes, “I meant around you, shy about committing to her feelings, not in general.”

You sighed. “I don’t know…”

“Well, maybe you two should just talk with each other, it’s been six years… It’s my wedding, I don’t want to have to worry about one of my best friends pining over the girl of her dreams without acting on her feelings for a second longer.”

“Sorry,” you mumbled.

“I’m kidding, Y/N,” he released his grip around your shoulders and started heading back to the centre of the party, “But I swear, if the next time I see you two, you aren’t sucking face, I’m gonna lock you both in a room until you finally open your god damn mouths and talk to each other.”

He walked away before you could answer and left you being not quite sure about whether he was kidding about that too or not.

Shaking your head you turned back around and your gaze landed yet again on Carol, she looked away quickly, as if she had been caught staring. Fury on the other hand nodded over to you and cast a smirk at Carol. As you approached the table he got up, straightening his trademark coat, that he apparently couldn’t even lose for a wedding, and shot you a wink before walking past you.

You looked after him and saw him join Natasha, who was also looking at you with a light grin. You turned around, groaning internally, apparently Tony wasn’t the only one trying to get you and Carol together.

You sat back down next to Carol but looked ahead instead of at her. Not quite sure about what to do or say, you stuffed your hands under your thighs, something Carol knew you did when you were nervous. She turned in her seat so that she was facing you.

“I’m sorry,” she said.

“About what?” you frowned and looked to the side and at her.

She squirmed a bit in her seat and took a look around, undoubtedly also noticing the various eyes of your teammates.

“Can we maybe go somewhere where we are alone for a second?”

“Is everything alright?”

“Yeah,” Carol breathed out, “I just- I think we should talk.”

Your heart pounded, despite what Tony had told you, you couldn’t help your mind from wandering. Maybe she found out that you felt more for her than solely friendship and wanted to reject you.

You still smiled at her. “Sure,” you said and got up after her.

Side by side you walked away from the party, a bit further around the lake and away from Tony’s house. It was more silent here, the music only hardly audible as well as the chatter of the guests.

Carol eventually sat down by the water’s edge at a spot where you were hidden by a big tree. You knelt down beside her and after a bit of squirming around settled for sitting cross-legged in front of her.

“You’re scaring me, Carol,” you whispered when she didn’t say anything, “What’s wrong.”

“Nothing,” she answered quickly and after hesitating for a second, she reached across from her and placed her hand on top of yours and slowly, to give you the chance to pull away, carded your fingers together. “I’m sorry, I said no.”

You blinked surprised. “Because of the dance?”

“Yeah,” she looked at you guiltily, “I wanted to, I really did, but…”

She wanted to look away, but you didn’t let her, you cupped her face and turned it back towards you.

“But what, Carol?”

She inhaled deeply, closing her eyes for a second. “I was afraid of how it might look, I- I know, you didn’t necessarily meant it to be… romantic, but I would want it to be and I’m just not accustomed to the thought that no-one here would bat an eye. If we had slow-danced together, back when I, you know, wasn’t yet Captain Marvel, it would have been more than just frowned upon. It’s just hard to shake the thought and god, that’s also why I can never bring myself to say a thing, but I really, really like you Y/N. Ever since we met, I’ve felt so close to you as I never did with anyone before.”

You looked at her softly, you had stayed silent, afraid that any reaction might cause her to stop talking, but now you stood up and smiling you held out your hand for her to take.

“May I have this dance?”

Carol blinked surprise, but quickly took your hand, letting you pull her up. You wrapped your arms around her neck and she rested her hands on your hips, you stood so close that you could feel each other’s heartbeats, mixing first and then turning into one.

You stared into each other’s eyes as you swayed to the distant sound of music, relishing this moment you had alone with the other.

“I feel the same, you know?” you finally told her too, making the widest smile appear on Carol’s face.

It dropped after a while though, “I don’t think I can be public about this yet.”

“That’s alright, Carol. We can take all the time you need, as long as I can be with you, I don’t care how, but you should know, that no-one here is going to think any differently of us.”

Carol smiled and looked at you with utter adoration, but instead of replying something she simply leaned in. She hesitated half-way, but you didn’t give her the time to pull away and took it upon you to bridge the small remaining gap between you.

When your lips met hers it was as if fireworks exploded in every nerve of your body, you leaned closer to her, deepening the kiss as Carol’s hands left your hips to tangle them in your hair. Everything you both had kept locked away the past years, broke free in this kiss as you finally let the other know how much you loved them.

When you eventually broke apart, both of you breathing heavily and your once so neatly made hair messy, you smiled at each other, both of you not quite able to comprehend your luck.

“That was long overdue,” you said, making Carol laugh lightly.

“It was,” she agreed and leaned in to give you another short kiss, “I think we should go back now, though, before someone goes looking for us.”

You nodded and took her hand as you walked back to the party, when you got so close that you were back in visual range, Carol gave your hand a light squeeze before letting go. You smiled at her softly, letting her know that it was okay that she wasn’t comfortable being too affectionate yet. You had time and you couldn’t be happier at the prospect of spending it with Carol.

“Or maybe she’s just shy?”

“You sure we’re talking about the same Carol Danvers? Captain Marvel, Ms. ‘Because before you didn’t have me’?”

Tony rolled his eyes, “I meant around you, shy about committing to her feelings, not in general.”

You sighed. “I don’t know…”

“Well, maybe you two should just talk with each other, it’s been six years… It’s my wedding, I don’t want to have to worry about one of my best friends pining over the girl of her dreams without acting on her feelings for a second longer.”

“Sorry,” you mumbled.

“I’m kidding, Y/N,” he released his grip around your shoulders and started heading back to the centre of the party, “But I swear, if the next time I see you two, you aren’t sucking face, I’m gonna lock you both in a room until you finally open your god damn mouths and talk to each other.”

He walked away before you could answer and left you being not quite sure about whether he was kidding about that too or not.

Shaking your head you turned back around and your gaze landed yet again on Carol, she looked away quickly, as if she had been caught staring. Fury on the other hand nodded over to you and cast a smirk at Carol. As you approached the table he got up, straightening his trademark coat, that he apparently couldn’t even lose for a wedding, and shot you a wink before walking past you.

You looked after him and saw him join Natasha, who was also looking at you with a light grin. You turned around, groaning internally, apparently Tony wasn’t the only one trying to get you and Carol together.

You sat back down next to Carol but looked ahead instead of at her. Not quite sure about what to do or say, you stuffed your hands under your thighs, something Carol knew you did when you were nervous. She turned in her seat so that she was facing you.

“I’m sorry,” she said.

“About what?” you frowned and looked to the side and at her.

She squirmed a bit in her seat and took a look around, undoubtedly also noticing the various eyes of your teammates.

“Can we maybe go somewhere where we are alone for a second?”

“Is everything alright?”

“Yeah,” Carol breathed out, “I just- I think we should talk.”

Your heart pounded, despite what Tony had told you, you couldn’t help your mind from wandering. Maybe she found out that you felt more for her than solely friendship and wanted to reject you.

You still smiled at her. “Sure,” you said and got up after her.

Side by side you walked away from the party, a bit further around the lake and away from Tony’s house. It was more silent here, the music only hardly audible as well as the chatter of the guests.

Carol eventually sat down by the water’s edge at a spot where you were hidden by a big tree. You knelt down beside her and after a bit of squirming around settled for sitting cross-legged in front of her.

“You’re scaring me, Carol,” you whispered when she didn’t say anything, “What’s wrong.”

“Nothing,” she answered quickly and after hesitating for a second, she reached across from her and placed her hand on top of yours and slowly, to give you the chance to pull away, carded your fingers together. “I’m sorry, I said no.”

You blinked surprised. “Because of the dance?”

“Yeah,” she looked at you guiltily, “I wanted to, I really did, but…”

She wanted to look away, but you didn’t let her, you cupped her face and turned it back towards you.

“But what, Carol?”

She inhaled deeply, closing her eyes for a second. “I was afraid of how it might look, I- I know, you didn’t necessarily meant it to be… romantic, but I would want it to be and I’m just not accustomed to the thought that no-one here would bat an eye. If we had slow-danced together, back when I, you know, wasn’t yet Captain Marvel, it would have been more than just frowned upon. It’s just hard to shake the thought and god, that’s also why I can never bring myself to say a thing, but I really, really like you Y/N. Ever since we met, I’ve felt so close to you as I never did with anyone before.”

You looked at her softly, you had stayed silent, afraid that any reaction might cause her to stop talking, but now you stood up and smiling you held out your hand for her to take.

“May I have this dance?”

Carol blinked surprise, but quickly took your hand, letting you pull her up. You wrapped your arms around her neck and she rested her hands on your hips, you stood so close that you could feel each other’s heartbeats, mixing first and then turning into one.

You stared into each other’s eyes as you swayed to the distant sound of music, relishing this moment you had alone with the other.

“I feel the same, you know?” you finally told her too, making the widest smile appear on Carol’s face.

It dropped after a while though, “I don’t think I can be public about this yet.”

“That’s alright, Carol. We can take all the time you need, as long as I can be with you, I don’t care how, but you should know, that no-one here is going to think any differently of us.”

Carol smiled and looked at you with utter adoration, but instead of replying something she simply leaned in. She hesitated half-way, but you didn’t give her the time to pull away and took it upon you to bridge the small remaining gap between you.

When your lips met hers it was as if fireworks exploded in every nerve of your body, you leaned closer to her, deepening the kiss as Carol’s hands left your hips to tangle them in your hair. Everything you both had kept locked away the past years, broke free in this kiss as you finally let the other know how much you loved them.

When you eventually broke apart, both of you breathing heavily and your once so neatly made hair messy, you smiled at each other, both of you not quite able to comprehend your luck.

“That was long overdue,” you said, making Carol laugh lightly.

“It was,” she agreed and leaned in to give you another short kiss, “I think we should go back now, though, before someone goes looking for us.”

You nodded and took her hand as you walked back to the party, when you got so close that you were back in visual range, Carol gave your hand a light squeeze before letting go. You smiled at her softly, letting her know that it was okay that she wasn’t comfortable being too affectionate yet. You had time and you couldn’t be happier at the prospect of spending it with Carol.

trail.content_raw:
Pride Prompt #17.2 (Carol x Fem!Reader)

Request: Hellooo may i request a carol x reader for pride month about carol feeling kinda insecure about showing affection to her gf in public because she has been in space for so long and doesn’t know that things changed a lot?

Note: Sooo, here’s as promised the second version, it’s very different from the other tbh xD I hope you guys like it, feedback is as always greatly appreciated <3

Warnings: none

Pairing: Carol Danvers x Fem!Reader

Words: 1835

Find my other Pride fics here.

.

You and Carol had been dancing around each other ever since the day you first met her 6 years ago when she arrived at the compound answering Fury’s call. She was beautiful, she was badass, she was kind… You were completely enamoured of her. And yet, you never actually said something about it to her, she liked you too, at least so you thought. You spend a lot of time together, talking and laughing about literally anything, but never really flirty, she might just see you as a friend, you thought and  today that assumption seemed to be proven as true.

[[MORE]]

Tony and Pepper were holding their second wedding to renew their vows now that all the dusted had been brought back and Thanos defeated. You and Carol had been seated at the same table and she was telling you about a wedding she had once attended on Hala, you always loved it when she told you about other galaxies and planets, but you never could keep the thought from your mind that there couldn’t possibly be someone or something more otherworldly than her.

You found your gaze trailing down to her lips as she spoke and only noticed what you were doing when Carol cleared her throat.

“Are you even listening to me?” She gave you a little shove and grinned.

Flustered you rubbed your neck. “Yeah, of course,” you finally met her gaze again, “I was just thinking, would you like to have a dance with me?”

It was only a dance, you told yourself, not an invitation for a date… There was absolutely no reason for your heart to beat as fast as it did in that moment.

“I- uhm- I don’t dance,” she evaded your gaze, seeming nervous, panicked even and you brushed it off with a smile, trying to hide your disappointment and excused yourself, saying that you should probably find Tony and Pepper anyway to congratulate them.

In the end it was only Tony you found, he was in the kitchen, looking for some extra dishes. He looked up when he heard you enter. You quickly gapped the space between you and wrapped your arms around him.

“I’m so happy for you, Tony,” you pulled away and smiled at him.

“Thank you, Y/N,” the pure joy that sparkled in Tony’s eyes when he answered was something you rarely saw on him, “Mind helping me?”

“Of course not,” you accepted the plates he handed you and walked outside with him again.

Tony nodded over to where Carol was still sitting at the table, now talking with Fury and smirked at you. “How’s it going with Danvers?”

You nearly let the plates drop. “Wh-What?”

Your answer only made your friend grin wider. “Come on, you are made for each other… I thought a romantic setting like this would maybe finally get you two to admit your feelings for each other.”

“Are you trying to set us up?”

“I just want to help you out,” he nudged your side with his shoulder.

“Whatever,” you rolled your eyes, “It doesn’t matter anyway, because she clearly doesn’t like me like that.”

Tony laughed, but stopped when he realized your sad expression. “Wait, seriously? No way, N/N. She’s pining for you just as much as you are pining for her, everyone can see that.”

You arrived at the buffet and set the dishes down but remained standing there with Tony as you kept on talking.

“Well, I don’t think she does.”

You tried to hide how much the thought hurt you, but Tony knew you too well, he wrapped an arm around your shoulders and pulled you into his side.

“She doesn’t even want to dance with me, she said ‘I don’t dance’ as if we haven’t been out for karaoke a thousand times with her dancing on table tops, maybe I shouldn’t have asked when there was such a slow song playing… She looked so uncomfortable when I asked her, Tony, maybe she isn’t even into girls.”

“Or maybe she’s just shy?”

“You sure we’re talking about the same Carol Danvers? Captain Marvel, Ms. ‘Because before you didn’t have me’?”

Tony rolled his eyes, “I meant around you, shy about committing to her feelings, not in general.”

You sighed. “I don’t know…”

“Well, maybe you two should just talk with each other, it’s been six years… It’s my wedding, I don’t want to have to worry about one of my best friends pining over the girl of her dreams without acting on her feelings for a second longer.”

“Sorry,” you mumbled.

“I’m kidding, Y/N,” he released his grip around your shoulders and started heading back to the centre of the party, “But I swear, if the next time I see you two, you aren’t sucking face, I’m gonna lock you both in a room until you finally open your god damn mouths and talk to each other.”

He walked away before you could answer and left you being not quite sure about whether he was kidding about that too or not.

Shaking your head you turned back around and your gaze landed yet again on Carol, she looked away quickly, as if she had been caught staring. Fury on the other hand nodded over to you and cast a smirk at Carol. As you approached the table he got up, straightening his trademark coat, that he apparently couldn’t even lose for a wedding, and shot you a wink before walking past you.

You looked after him and saw him join Natasha, who was also looking at you with a light grin. You turned around, groaning internally, apparently Tony wasn’t the only one trying to get you and Carol together.

You sat back down next to Carol but looked ahead instead of at her. Not quite sure about what to do or say, you stuffed your hands under your thighs, something Carol knew you did when you were nervous. She turned in her seat so that she was facing you.

“I’m sorry,” she said.

“About what?” you frowned and looked to the side and at her.

She squirmed a bit in her seat and took a look around, undoubtedly also noticing the various eyes of your teammates.

“Can we maybe go somewhere where we are alone for a second?”

“Is everything alright?”

“Yeah,” Carol breathed out, “I just- I think we should talk.”

Your heart pounded, despite what Tony had told you, you couldn’t help your mind from wandering. Maybe she found out that you felt more for her than solely friendship and wanted to reject you.

You still smiled at her. “Sure,” you said and got up after her.

Side by side you walked away from the party, a bit further around the lake and away from Tony’s house. It was more silent here, the music only hardly audible as well as the chatter of the guests.

Carol eventually sat down by the water’s edge at a spot where you were hidden by a big tree. You knelt down beside her and after a bit of squirming around settled for sitting cross-legged in front of her.

“You’re scaring me, Carol,” you whispered when she didn’t say anything, “What’s wrong.”

“Nothing,” she answered quickly and after hesitating for a second, she reached across from her and placed her hand on top of yours and slowly, to give you the chance to pull away, carded your fingers together. “I’m sorry, I said no.”

You blinked surprised. “Because of the dance?”

“Yeah,” she looked at you guiltily, “I wanted to, I really did, but…”

She wanted to look away, but you didn’t let her, you cupped her face and turned it back towards you.

“But what, Carol?”

She inhaled deeply, closing her eyes for a second. “I was afraid of how it might look, I- I know, you didn’t necessarily meant it to be… romantic, but I would want it to be and I’m just not accustomed to the thought that no-one here would bat an eye. If we had slow-danced together, back when I, you know, wasn’t yet Captain Marvel, it would have been more than just frowned upon. It’s just hard to shake the thought and god, that’s also why I can never bring myself to say a thing, but I really, really like you Y/N. Ever since we met, I’ve felt so close to you as I never did with anyone before.”

You looked at her softly, you had stayed silent, afraid that any reaction might cause her to stop talking, but now you stood up and smiling you held out your hand for her to take.

“May I have this dance?”

Carol blinked surprise, but quickly took your hand, letting you pull her up. You wrapped your arms around her neck and she rested her hands on your hips, you stood so close that you could feel each other’s heartbeats, mixing first and then turning into one.

You stared into each other’s eyes as you swayed to the distant sound of music, relishing this moment you had alone with the other.

“I feel the same, you know?” you finally told her too, making the widest smile appear on Carol’s face.

It dropped after a while though, “I don’t think I can be public about this yet.”

“That’s alright, Carol. We can take all the time you need, as long as I can be with you, I don’t care how, but you should know, that no-one here is going to think any differently of us.”

Carol smiled and looked at you with utter adoration, but instead of replying something she simply leaned in. She hesitated half-way, but you didn’t give her the time to pull away and took it upon you to bridge the small remaining gap between you.

When your lips met hers it was as if fireworks exploded in every nerve of your body, you leaned closer to her, deepening the kiss as Carol’s hands left your hips to tangle them in your hair. Everything you both had kept locked away the past years, broke free in this kiss as you finally let the other know how much you loved them.

When you eventually broke apart, both of you breathing heavily and your once so neatly made hair messy, you smiled at each other, both of you not quite able to comprehend your luck.

“That was long overdue,” you said, making Carol laugh lightly.

“It was,” she agreed and leaned in to give you another short kiss, “I think we should go back now, though, before someone goes looking for us.”

You nodded and took her hand as you walked back to the party, when you got so close that you were back in visual range, Carol gave your hand a light squeeze before letting go. You smiled at her softly, letting her know that it was okay that she wasn’t comfortable being too affectionate yet. You had time and you couldn’t be happier at the prospect of spending it with Carol.

She was beautiful, she was badass, she was kind… You were completely enamoured of her. And yet, you never actually said something about it to her, she liked you too, at least so you thought. You spend a lot of time together, talking and laughing about literally anything, but never really flirty, she might just see you as a friend, you thought and  today that assumption seemed to be proven as true.

“I’m so happy for you, Tony,” you pulled away and smiled at him.

“Thank you, Y/N,” the pure joy that sparkled in Tony’s eyes when he answered was something you rarely saw on him, “Mind helping me?”

“Of course not,” you accepted the plates he handed you and walked outside with him again.

Tony nodded over to where Carol was still sitting at the table, now talking with Fury and smirked at you. “How’s it going with Danvers?”

You nearly let the plates drop. “Wh-What?”

Your answer only made your friend grin wider. “Come on, you are made for each other… I thought a romantic setting like this would maybe finally get you two to admit your feelings for each other.”

You tried to hide how much the thought hurt you, but Tony knew you too well, he wrapped an arm around your shoulders and pulled you into his side.

“You sure we’re talking about the same Carol Danvers? Captain Marvel, Ms. ‘Because before you didn’t have me’?”

Tony rolled his eyes, “I meant around you, shy about committing to her feelings, not in general.”

You sighed. “I don’t know…”

“Sorry,” you mumbled.

“I’m kidding, Y/N,” he released his grip around your shoulders and started heading back to the centre of the party, “But I swear, if the next time I see you two, you aren’t sucking face, I’m gonna lock you both in a room until you finally open your god damn mouths and talk to each other.”

He walked away before you could answer and left you being not quite sure about whether he was kidding about that too or not.

Shaking your head you turned back around and your gaze landed yet again on Carol, she looked away quickly, as if she had been caught staring. Fury on the other hand nodded over to you and cast a smirk at Carol. As you approached the table he got up, straightening his trademark coat, that he apparently couldn’t even lose for a wedding, and shot you a wink before walking past you.

You looked after him and saw him join Natasha, who was also looking at you with a light grin. You turned around, groaning internally, apparently Tony wasn’t the only one trying to get you and Carol together.

You sat back down next to Carol but looked ahead instead of at her. Not quite sure about what to do or say, you stuffed your hands under your thighs, something Carol knew you did when you were nervous. She turned in her seat so that she was facing you.

“I’m sorry,” she said.

“About what?” you frowned and looked to the side and at her.

She squirmed a bit in her seat and took a look around, undoubtedly also noticing the various eyes of your teammates.

“Can we maybe go somewhere where we are alone for a second?”

“Is everything alright?”

“Yeah,” Carol breathed out, “I just- I think we should talk.”

Your heart pounded, despite what Tony had told you, you couldn’t help your mind from wandering. Maybe she found out that you felt more for her than solely friendship and wanted to reject you.

You still smiled at her. “Sure,” you said and got up after her.

Side by side you walked away from the party, a bit further around the lake and away from Tony’s house. It was more silent here, the music only hardly audible as well as the chatter of the guests.

Carol eventually sat down by the water’s edge at a spot where you were hidden by a big tree. You knelt down beside her and after a bit of squirming around settled for sitting cross-legged in front of her.

You blinked surprised. “Because of the dance?”

“Yeah,” she looked at you guiltily, “I wanted to, I really did, but…”

She wanted to look away, but you didn’t let her, you cupped her face and turned it back towards you.

“But what, Carol?”

She inhaled deeply, closing her eyes for a second. “I was afraid of how it might look, I- I know, you didn’t necessarily meant it to be… romantic, but I would want it to be and I’m just not accustomed to the thought that no-one here would bat an eye. If we had slow-danced together, back when I, you know, wasn’t yet Captain Marvel, it would have been more than just frowned upon. It’s just hard to shake the thought and god, that’s also why I can never bring myself to say a thing, but I really, really like you Y/N. Ever since we met, I’ve felt so close to you as I never did with anyone before.”

You looked at her softly, you had stayed silent, afraid that any reaction might cause her to stop talking, but now you stood up and smiling you held out your hand for her to take.

Carol blinked surprise, but quickly took your hand, letting you pull her up. You wrapped your arms around her neck and she rested her hands on your hips, you stood so close that you could feel each other’s heartbeats, mixing first and then turning into one.

You stared into each other’s eyes as you swayed to the distant sound of music, relishing this moment you had alone with the other.

“I feel the same, you know?” you finally told her too, making the widest smile appear on Carol’s face.

It dropped after a while though, “I don’t think I can be public about this yet.”

“That’s alright, Carol. We can take all the time you need, as long as I can be with you, I don’t care how, but you should know, that no-one here is going to think any differently of us.”

Carol smiled and looked at you with utter adoration, but instead of replying something she simply leaned in. She hesitated half-way, but you didn’t give her the time to pull away and took it upon you to bridge the small remaining gap between you.

When your lips met hers it was as if fireworks exploded in every nerve of your body, you leaned closer to her, deepening the kiss as Carol’s hands left your hips to tangle them in your hair. Everything you both had kept locked away the past years, broke free in this kiss as you finally let the other know how much you loved them.

title: Pneumonia
body:
Summary: You get really sick and Carol comes to take care of you until you feel better.

Part:1/1

Pairing: Carol x reader

Warnings: sickness, mentions of throwing up

Word count: 573

A/N: Here’s a little Carol Danvers blurb for ya. Enjoy!



You honestly felt like absolute garbage. Your nose was all stuffy, your throat was sore, and every muscle was aching while your body felt aflame. You were hit by a wave of nausea and hated every moment of it. Especially after. Brushing your teeth and rinsing out your mouth, you returned to bed and continued the episode.

The ringing of your phone sent a pinch of pain through your brain and you groaned as you rolled over to answer it. It was your girlfriend. Shit.

“Hey.” The hoarse sound of your voice made you cringe. And she clearly noticed it was off.

“Y/N? Are you okay? You didn’t show up for our date tonight. Or yesterday’s lunch. What’s going on babe?”

“I’m disgustingly sick. Doctor says I’ve got pneumonia. Sorry I didn’t text, my energy has been low lately. And I didn’t want to get you sick.”

“I’ve got Kree blood flowing through my veins and I can shoot photon blasts out of my hands. And you’re worried about my immune system?” She chuckles. “That’s so sweet. But I’m coming over.”

Before you could interject she ended the call, so you simply slumped back into bed and continued your marathon. About an episode and a half later there was a knock at the door and a creaking noise as it opened.

“Y/NN?” Her voice was so soft as she peeked around the corner and into your room, her arms full of grocery bags. “I bring food and necessities.”

“Necessities?”

“Yep. I’ve got a mask for me to wear so you worry less, and few boxes of tissues. Also a little garbage can that you can use and some mints to help get rid of the aftertaste when you, you know.” She pulls out object after object and you can’t help but melt at the thought of her out in a store scanning aisles for things to make you feel better.

“Carol… you didn’t have to do that.” She holds up a hand, shaking her head as she removes everything from the bags.

“But I wanted to.” She hands you a bowl of fruit and a box of tissues, wrapping you in a blanket and pulling up a chair. Carol sits in the chair beside your bed and watches Netflix with you, helping when you feel nauseous another wave of nausea.

She stays, the entire time you’re sick. Always ready to jump into action if you ran low on something or needed any help. You were honestly just glad that she was there, her presence alone was enough.

When you were better you took her to breakfast and lunch, and cooked her dinner to thank her for all her help. You were currently washing the dishes of said dinner as she packed away the leftovers and cleared the table.

After you finally finished you find her scanning your movie collection, deep in thought. You spin her around and wrap your arms around her, pressing a light kiss to her lips.

You had been desperate to be close to her after so long of not being able to touch her and feeling absolutely horrid. Honestly, you just wanted to be with your girlfriend after all that. You wanted to feel good and be happy. To forget the sickness. And you knew just what to do.

“Maybe we just skip the movie?” A smirk tugged at your lips and hers.

“Hmmm. Maybe we do.”


~

Summary: You get really sick and Carol comes to take care of you until you feel better.

reblog.comment:
Summary: You get really sick and Carol comes to take care of you until you feel better.

Part:1/1

Pairing: Carol x reader

Warnings: sickness, mentions of throwing up

Word count: 573

A/N: Here’s a little Carol Danvers blurb for ya. Enjoy!


[[MORE]]


You honestly felt like absolute garbage. Your nose was all stuffy, your throat was sore, and every muscle was aching while your body felt aflame. You were hit by a wave of nausea and hated every moment of it. Especially after. Brushing your teeth and rinsing out your mouth, you returned to bed and continued the episode.

The ringing of your phone sent a pinch of pain through your brain and you groaned as you rolled over to answer it. It was your girlfriend. Shit.

“Hey.” The hoarse sound of your voice made you cringe. And she clearly noticed it was off.

“Y/N? Are you okay? You didn’t show up for our date tonight. Or yesterday’s lunch. What’s going on babe?”

“I’m disgustingly sick. Doctor says I’ve got pneumonia. Sorry I didn’t text, my energy has been low lately. And I didn’t want to get you sick.”

“I’ve got Kree blood flowing through my veins and I can shoot photon blasts out of my hands. And you’re worried about my immune system?” She chuckles. “That’s so sweet. But I’m coming over.”

Before you could interject she ended the call, so you simply slumped back into bed and continued your marathon. About an episode and a half later there was a knock at the door and a creaking noise as it opened.

“Y/NN?” Her voice was so soft as she peeked around the corner and into your room, her arms full of grocery bags. “I bring food and necessities.”

“Necessities?”

“Yep. I’ve got a mask for me to wear so you worry less, and few boxes of tissues. Also a little garbage can that you can use and some mints to help get rid of the aftertaste when you, you know.” She pulls out object after object and you can’t help but melt at the thought of her out in a store scanning aisles for things to make you feel better.

“Carol… you didn’t have to do that.” She holds up a hand, shaking her head as she removes everything from the bags.

“But I wanted to.” She hands you a bowl of fruit and a box of tissues, wrapping you in a blanket and pulling up a chair. Carol sits in the chair beside your bed and watches Netflix with you, helping when you feel nauseous another wave of nausea.

She stays, the entire time you’re sick. Always ready to jump into action if you ran low on something or needed any help. You were honestly just glad that she was there, her presence alone was enough.

When you were better you took her to breakfast and lunch, and cooked her dinner to thank her for all her help. You were currently washing the dishes of said dinner as she packed away the leftovers and cleared the table.

After you finally finished you find her scanning your movie collection, deep in thought. You spin her around and wrap your arms around her, pressing a light kiss to her lips.

You had been desperate to be close to her after so long of not being able to touch her and feeling absolutely horrid. Honestly, you just wanted to be with your girlfriend after all that. You wanted to feel good and be happy. To forget the sickness. And you knew just what to do.

“Maybe we just skip the movie?” A smirk tugged at your lips and hers.

“Hmmm. Maybe we do.”


~

Please let me know if you’d like to join any tags! Feel free to keep sending in requests!

Taglist: @qtmeryr @broken-hearted-barnes
